p: Some of these compounds were also present in N. arvensis seeds ( Alu'datt et al., 2016), while 7-methylkaempferol (rhamnocitrin) was also reported in the epigeal part of this species ( Kirichenko et al., 1972). Other type of phenolic compounds reported in N. damascena seeds were hydroxytyrosol (66), 2,4-dihydroxyphenylacetic acid (67) and its methyl derivative (68), as well as a new phenolic ester, 1- O-(2,4-dihydroxy) benzoylglycerol 69) ( Fico et al., 2000) ( Figure 4).
